text: hi everyone head than the ouch tano here
the internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review of the new dijon
album absolutely this is the debut
full-length album from california singer
and songwriter and multi-instrumentalist
dijon a guy who i heard some buzz from
last year off of a few semi-popular
singles as well as
this how do you feel about getting
married ep
how could i forget this cover art but
actually i kind of lost touch with his
stuff but then was later reminded of him
through gene dawson who highly
recommended the
material he was coming together with on
his latest lp here saying it was shaping
up to be really good which was in fact
the case and while absolutely isn't a
perfect record i hope it does make dijon
an artist to watch because there is a
lot of potential packed in this lp one
of my favorite things about this project
is the vibe yes the vibe every track on
this thing sounds like it was born out
of a really great impromptu live session
packed with a bunch of musicians or at
least that's what the performance videos
on dijon's youtube channel seem to imply
and there's just an intimate organic and
amazing feel to these recordings as a
result especially the subtler ones like
the opening track big mics which is this
slow serene ballad very easy going sets
the tone for the record perfectly it
features touches of singer songwriter
music r b
with some bedroom aesthetics dijon's
voicings passionately over these gentle
but raw bits of guitar keys drums and
bass the track just has a beautiful and
entrancing performance along with noah's
highlight reel which interestingly pulls
together elements of r b jazz as well as
country in a way that honestly i've
never heard before and not only is it a
great performance interesting blend of
sounds just beautiful song but it's got
a theater of the mind quality to it as
well with the sound effects and the
crowd and commotion sounds the ambient
noise it really has a strong sense of
place that is a little surreal the whole
thing feels like it's taking place in a
dream i'm having i also want to give a
shout out to the song rodeo clown whose
vocal performance kills me dijon's
heart-wrenching uh vocals singing about
you missing it out you miss it out like
the way his voice is just
cracking is shattering on that track is
just it's devastating it's so distraught
so yes the slow burners are great and
there are some bops in the track list
too many times is a slick and rock and
cut with one of the best vocal
performances on the entire thing i love
how manic the verses are on this track
they're so fast they're so intense but
it slows down perfectly into this
surgical and insanely catchy chorus
aesthetically with all the
instrumentation there's this weird
collapsing of some 80s sounds some 90s
sounds again like bedroom pop aesthetics
from today and somehow it all works i
mean of course the song being great and
the performance being killer helps then
the track the dress is packed with this
romantic nostalgia icy keyboard smooth
groove it's beautiful it's melodramatic
it sounds like the soundtrack to a scene
from an 80s rom-com talk downs another
hard-hitting highlight in the tracklist
too sees dijon messing with some brake
beats as well as strange and somewhat
unsettling vocal overdubs so yeah all
these tracks i mentioned i like i like
quite a bit but they're all surrounded
by cuts that don't really bring as
strong a structure or an idea maybe are
a bit on the short side that's not to
say that they don't have their moments
though like with god and wilson for
example which comes to this weirdly
beautiful country shoegaze finish but
yeah some tracks on this lp just aren't
as well developed are just shorter or
more scant than others which i suppose
is sort of the case for the project
overall too so yeah while there are
great ideas on this lp very good
performances fantastic live
instrumentation it does leave me wanting
more and wondering how
another dijon record would sound were it
to be i guess a bit more planned out
still though i do recommend checking
this project out because it's got a lot
of great stuff on it and dijon again is
is certainly somebody who i'm going to
be keeping tabs on for a minute feeling
a light to decent seven on this one tran
position have you given this album a
listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
next hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well over here next to my head
it's another video that you can check
out hit that up or the link to subscribe
to the channel anthony fantano dijon
forever
